terminology: Perimenopause - the transitional phase before menopause, typically ages 40-55, where hormones begin fluctuating unpredictably
B.L.O.O.M. Method - Baseline, Listen, Optimize, Observe, Maintain framework for hormone health coaching
Estrogen dominance - relative excess of estrogen compared to progesterone, common in perimenopause
Cortisol-hormone connection - how chronic stress disrupts the entire hormonal cascade
Seed cycling - using specific seeds during menstrual phases to support hormone production
Adrenal fatigue pattern - when prolonged stress exhausts the adrenals, impacting all downstream hormones
Scope of practice - educate and support with lifestyle and nutrition strategies, never diagnose or prescribe HRT
clientExamples: Women 40-55 in perimenopause experiencing brain fog, hot flashes, mood swings, and weight gain
Women whose doctors dismissed their symptoms as 'normal aging' or prescribed antidepressants instead of investigating hormones
Postmenopausal women struggling with low energy, libido changes, and metabolic shifts
Women considering HRT who want complementary lifestyle and nutrition support
Anyone who feels like their body turned against them overnight and wants answers
practiceType: Hormone health coaching focused on nutrition, lifestyle optimization, stress management, and hormonal stage-specific strategies for women 40+
